result.execSummary:
The defendant Trederick L Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trederick L Nelson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trederick L Nelson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Trederick L Nelson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia, alcohol and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Shall not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.
Use of sobrietor if deemed appropriate by agent. Random UA & BA testing at minimum every 2 weeks. DNA On file.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

records.addlTxt: of representation
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Trederick L Nelson in court.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Trederick L Nelson.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea cts 2, 3. 24 mo probation. Argument by DE. Statement by DE. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 2, 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1 . 
Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   2, 3
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  2 years , cc to each other and case 21CM144

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription

-Random UA and BA testing every 2 weeks
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

-Shall not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol
-Use of Sobrieter if deemed appropriate by agent.

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 2, 3
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-Days credit for time already served:  21 (2/9/22 - 3/1/22)
-Days credit if revoked: 21

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
